article_title: Should we have two? – The Denver Post
article_text:
Cantaloupe or peaches? Alamosa Republican state Sen. Larry Crowder wants both to be Colorado’s official state fruits.

Crowder said Friday that he will attempt to add Rock Ford cantaloupe to a bill introduced in the Legislature to make the Palisade peach Colorado’s official state fruit.

Crowder told the Pueblo Chieftain that both fruits have a comparable history in the state. Palisade peaches are grown on the Western Slope near Grand Junction. Rocky Ford cantaloupes are grown in southeastern Colorado.

Palisade peaches are grown on the Western Slope near Grand Junction.
Cantaloupe or peaches?
Rocky Ford cantaloupes are grown in southeastern Colorado.
